intro: Alpinia edanoi, commonly known as the black ginger, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black rhizomes, which are highly aromatic and used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Alpinia edanoi is typically grown for its ornamental value as well as its medicinal properties.
